meanings.definition: To make (something) totalitarian in character or nature.
meanings.sent1: The government was totalitarianizing the country, taking away people's freedoms.
meanings.sent2: She was totalitarianizing the organization, exerting complete control over every aspect.
meanings.sent3: The cat was totalitarianizing the house, demanding to be fed at all hours.
meanings.sent4: The storm was totalitarianizing the landscape, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The dictator was totalitarianizing the nation, suppressing any form of dissent.

meanings.definition: The act of imposing a totalitarian system or control over a society or group.
meanings.sent1: The totalitarianizing of the society led to widespread fear and oppression.
meanings.sent2: The totalitarianizing of the group was met with resistance from its members.
meanings.sent3: The clown's attempt at totalitarianizing the circus led to chaos and laughter.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of night felt like a totalitarianizing force, enveloping everything in its grip.
meanings.sent5: The totalitarianizing of the company culture stifled creativity and innovation.
